001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of

004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.hal.DigitalGlitchFilterJNI;
008import edu.wpi.first.hal.FRCNetComm.tResourceType;
009import edu.wpi.first.hal.HAL;
010import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.Sendable;
011import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.SendableBuilder;
012import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.SendableRegistry;
013import java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock;
014import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock;
015
016/**
017 * Class to enable glitch filtering on a set of digital inputs. This class will manage adding and
018 * removing digital inputs from a FPGA glitch filter. The filter lets the user configure the time
019 * that an input must remain high or low before it is classified as high or low.
020 */
021public class DigitalGlitchFilter implements Sendable, AutoCloseable {
022  /** Configures the Digital Glitch Filter to its default settings. */
023  public DigitalGlitchFilter() {
024    synchronized (m_mutex) {
025      int index = 0;
026      while (m_filterAllocated[index] && index < m_filterAllocated.length) {
027        index++;
028      }
029      if (index != m_filterAllocated.length) {
030        m_channelIndex = index;
031        m_filterAllocated[index] = true;
032        HAL.report(tResourceType.kResourceType_DigitalGlitchFilter, m_channelIndex + 1, 0);
033        SendableRegistry.addLW(this, "DigitalGlitchFilter", index);
034      }
035    }
036  }
037
038  @Override
039  public void close() {
040    SendableRegistry.remove(this);
041    if (m_channelIndex >= 0) {
042      synchronized (m_mutex) {
043        m_filterAllocated[m_channelIndex] = false;
044      }
045      m_channelIndex = -1;
046    }
047  }
048
049  private static void setFilter(DigitalSource input, int channelIndex) {
050    if (input != null) { // Counter might have just one input
051      // analog triggers are not supported for DigitalGlitchFilters
052      if (input.isAnalogTrigger()) {
053        throw new IllegalStateException("Analog Triggers not supported for DigitalGlitchFilters");
054      }
055      DigitalGlitchFilterJNI.setFilterSelect(input.getPortHandleForRouting(), channelIndex);
056
057      int selected = DigitalGlitchFilterJNI.getFilterSelect(input.getPortHandleForRouting());
058      if (selected != channelIndex) {
059        throw new IllegalStateException(
060            "DigitalGlitchFilterJNI.setFilterSelect(" + channelIndex + ") failed -> " + selected);
061      }
062    }
063  }
064
065  /**
066   * Assigns the DigitalSource to this glitch filter.
067   *
068   * @param input The DigitalSource to add.
069   */
070  public void add(DigitalSource input) {
071    setFilter(input, m_channelIndex + 1);
072  }
073
074  /**
075   * Assigns the Encoder to this glitch filter.
076   *
077   * @param input The Encoder to add.
078   */
079  public void add(Encoder input) {
080    add(input.m_aSource);
081    add(input.m_bSource);
082  }
083
084  /**
085   * Assigns the Counter to this glitch filter.
086   *
087   * @param input The Counter to add.
088   */
089  public void add(Counter input) {
090    add(input.m_upSource);
091    add(input.m_downSource);
092  }
093
094  /**
095   * Removes this filter from the given digital input.
096   *
097   * @param input The DigitalSource to stop filtering.
098   */
099  public void remove(DigitalSource input) {
100    setFilter(input, 0);
101  }
102
103  /**
104   * Removes this filter from the given Encoder.
105   *
106   * @param input the Encoder to stop filtering.
107   */
108  public void remove(Encoder input) {
109    remove(input.m_aSource);
110    remove(input.m_bSource);
111  }
112
113  /**
114   * Removes this filter from the given Counter.
115   *
116   * @param input The Counter to stop filtering.
117   */
118  public void remove(Counter input) {
119    remove(input.m_upSource);
120    remove(input.m_downSource);
121  }
122
123  /**
124   * Sets the number of FPGA cycles that the input must hold steady to pass through this glitch
125   * filter.
126   *
127   * @param fpgaCycles The number of FPGA cycles.
128   */
129  public void setPeriodCycles(int fpgaCycles) {
130    DigitalGlitchFilterJNI.setFilterPeriod(m_channelIndex, fpgaCycles);
131  }
132
133  /**
134   * Sets the number of nanoseconds that the input must hold steady to pass through this glitch
135   * filter.
136   *
137   * @param nanoseconds The number of nanoseconds.
138   */
139  public void setPeriodNanoSeconds(long nanoseconds) {
140    int fpgaCycles = (int) (nanoseconds * SensorUtil.kSystemClockTicksPerMicrosecond / 4 / 1000);
141    setPeriodCycles(fpgaCycles);
142  }
143
144  /**
145   * Gets the number of FPGA cycles that the input must hold steady to pass through this glitch
146   * filter.
147   *
148   * @return The number of cycles.
149   */
150  public int getPeriodCycles() {
151    return DigitalGlitchFilterJNI.getFilterPeriod(m_channelIndex);
152  }
153
154  /**
155   * Gets the number of nanoseconds that the input must hold steady to pass through this glitch
156   * filter.
157   *
158   * @return The number of nanoseconds.
159   */
160  public long getPeriodNanoSeconds() {
161    int fpgaCycles = getPeriodCycles();
162
163    return (long) fpgaCycles * 1000L / (long) (SensorUtil.kSystemClockTicksPerMicrosecond / 4);
164  }
165
166  @Override
167  public void initSendable(SendableBuilder builder) {}
168
169  private int m_channelIndex = -1;
170  private static final Lock m_mutex = new ReentrantLock(true);
171  private static final boolean[] m_filterAllocated = new boolean[3];
172}
